articles.title: Plymouth Argyle suffer double injury blow ahead of Sunderland clash in League One - Sunderland Echo
articles.description: Sunderland’s play-off rivals in League One, Plymouth Argyle, have been hit with a double injury blow.
articles.content:
Sunderland are set to face Plymouth in League One on Saturday, April 18.
The Pilgrims are currently fourth in the table, three places and seven points ahead of Alex Neils Black Cats, who are now out… [+1822 chars]

articles.title: Are Honda back following Iker Lecuona’s impressive top three finish? - Crash
articles.description: Iker Lecuona was undeniably one of the stars of WorldSBK pre-season testing in Catalunya as the former MotoGP rider mixed it at the front with the likes of world champion Toprak Razgatlioglu, Jonathan Rea and Alvaro Bautista.
articles.content:
The 2022 WorldSBK rookie made a relatively slow start during Fridays action after finishing outside the top ten, however, Iker Lecuona was immediately on the pace come the start of day-two. 
Despite… [+2159 chars]

articles.title: Daniil Medvedev backtracks on Rafael Nadal Australian Open final claim after Miami win - Express
articles.description: DANIIL MEDVEDEV previously accused the Australian Open crowd of killing his childhood dream.
articles.content: Medvedev defeated Andy Murray in straight sets at the Miami Open on Saturday, inching him closer to regaining the world No 1 ranking from Novak Djokovic. The 26-year-old became the first man outside … [+2402 chars]

articles.title: United Rugby Championship: Sharks 5-21 Edinburgh - Scottish side claim landmark win - BBC
articles.description: Returning Scotland international Blair Kinghorn crosses twice as Edinburgh subdue Sharks to earn the first United Rugby Championship win by a northern hemisphere side in South Africa.
articles.content:
Blair Kinghorn (left) and Emiliano Boffelli scored Edinburgh's tries in a memorable away victory
